intro: Tetrastigma sorsogonense, commonly known as the Sorsogon Province vine, is a climbing plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Vitaceae family and is characterized by its tendrils and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by yellowish berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species for local biodiversity and ecological studies.
